DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject Class

Definition

Provides information about a DataGridViewRow to accessibility client applications.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
protected class DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject : System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

Remarks

Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications. Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject class inherits from the AccessibleObject class to provide information about a DataGridViewRow to accessibility client applications. Each class that represents a visual part of the DataGridView—such as DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell, DataGridViewRowHeaderCell, DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewCell—also contains a class that inherits from AccessibleObject to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the DataGridView control, to accessibility client applications. There are two ways of providing this additional information. To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's AccessibleName and AccessibleDescription property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

Note

You should change the AccessibleDefaultActionDescription and AccessibleRole property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a DataGridView look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom DataGridView or DataGridViewCell. To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject or DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject classes and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method. For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject class and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method.

The DataGridView exposes its data structure by using AccessibleRole values to define the data table hierarchy. For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Constructors

DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject()

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject class without setting the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property.

public DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject ();

DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject(DataGridViewRow)

Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject class, setting the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property to the specified DataGridViewRow.

public DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow owner);
owner
DataGridViewRow

The DataGridViewRow that owns the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject

Properties

Bounds

Gets the location and size of the accessible object.

public override System.Drawing.Rectangle Bounds { get; }
Value
Rectangle

A Rectangle that represents the bounds of the accessible object.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The Bounds property retrieves the object's bounding rectangle in screen coordinates.

Name

Gets the name of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

public override string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The Name property returns a string that includes the Index property.

Owner

Gets or sets the DataGridViewRow to which this DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject applies.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow Owner { get; set; }
Value
DataGridViewRow

The DataGridViewRow that owns this DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

When setting this property, the Owner property has already been set.

Parent

Gets the parent of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Parent { get; }
Value
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

The DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject that belongs to the DataGridView.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Role

Gets the role of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Role { get; }
Value
AccessibleRole

The AccessibleRole value.

State

Gets the state of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates State { get; }
Value
AccessibleStates

A bitwise combination of AccessibleStates values. The default is the bitwise combination of the AccessibleStates and AccessibleStates values.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The State property includes the AccessibleStates value if the all of the DataGridViewCell objects in the row are selected. State does not indicate whether the row has scrolled out of view.

Value

Gets the value of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

public override string Value { get; }
Value
String

The value of the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The Value property includes the Value property for each cell in the row. Value returns the string "(Create New)" if the current row is a new row.

Methods

GetChild(Int32)

Returns the accessible child corresponding to the specified index.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetChild (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the accessible child.

Returns
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

A DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject that represents the DataGridViewCell corresponding to the specified index.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

index is less than 0.

-or-

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

GetChildCount()

Returns the number of children belonging to the accessible object.

public override int GetChildCount ();
Returns
Int32

The number of child accessible objects that belong to the DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject corresponds to the number of visible columns in the DataGridView. If the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible* property is true, the GetChildCount method includes the DataGridViewRowHeaderCell in the count of child accessible objects.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

GetFocused()

Returns the accessible object that has keyboard focus.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetFocused ();
Returns
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

A DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject if the cell indicated by the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CurrentCell* property has keyboard focus and is in the current DataGridViewRow; otherwise, null.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

GetSelected()

Gets an accessible object that represents the currently selected DataGridViewCell objects.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetSelected ();
Returns
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

An accessible object that represents the currently selected DataGridViewCell objects in the DataGridViewRow.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Navigate(AccessibleNavigation)

Navigates to another accessible object.

public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Navigate (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation navigationDirection);
navigationDirection
AccessibleNavigation

One of the AccessibleNavigation values.

Returns
System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

An AccessibleObject that represents an object in the specified direction.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The following table describes the AccessibleObject that the Navigate method will return for each navdir value.

Parameter value Return value
AccessibleNavigation or AccessibleNavigation An accessible object for the DataGridViewRow below the current row.
AccessibleNavigation or AccessibleNavigation An accessible object for the DataGridViewRow above the current row.
AccessibleNavigation An accessible object for the first DataGridViewCell in the row. The DataGridViewRowHeaderCell is the first cell if RowHeadersVisible is true.
AccessibleNavigation An accessible object for the last DataGridViewCell in the row.
All other AccessibleNavigation values null.

Select(AccessibleSelection)

Modifies the selection or moves the keyboard focus of the accessible object.

public override void Select (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection flags);
flags
AccessibleSelection

One of the AccessibleSelection values.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

Remarks

The following table describes the action that Select method will perform for each flags value.

Parameter value Action
AccessibleSelection The DataGridView takes focus.
AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell in the row takes focus.
AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell is added to the SelectedCells property.
AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell is removed from the SelectedCells property.

When you specify the AccessibleSelection value, the column of the DataGridViewCell that currently has focus is the same as the cell that will take focus in the current DataGridViewRow. For example, if row 10, cell 3 has focus, and you specify AccessibleSelection for row 15, then row 15, cell 3 will have focus. The first cell in the row will take focus if no DataGridViewCell in the DataGridView has focus.
